newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: India offers July Madras high aromatic naphtha.
newsitem.headline: India offers July Madras high aromatic naphtha.

text.p: State-owned Indian Oil Corp (IOC) has issued a tender to sell 27,000 tonnes of high aromatic naphtha (HAN) lifting July 24-26 from Madras on the east coast, industry sources said on Monday.
The tender closes July 10 and is valid for a day.
IOC's last HAN tender from Madras, for 25,000 tonnes lifting May 12-14, was awarded at a $19.50 per tonne discount to Japanese spot quotes on a free-on-board (fob) basis.
Its last HAN cargo, used mainly for the production of gasoline, was from Cochin on the west coast lifting June 30-July 2 and was awarded at a $30-$35 discount, fob.
